intro: Calandrinia dianthoides, commonly known as the common sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows in dry, sandy soils. The plant produces small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often resembling those of the genus Dianthus. Its foliage is usually linear and grass-like, and it has a compact growth habit. Calandrinia dianthoides is adapted to arid environments and is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats.
